name: Simple Majority
description: Requires a simple majority (more than 50% of cast votes) to pass. If 50% or fewer vote yes, it fails.

name: Unanimous Consensus
description: Requires 100% of the votes cast to be YES. If there is even a single NO vote, the proposal fails immediately.

name: Benevolent Dictator
description: If user 'king_arthur' proposes the action, it passes immediately. Otherwise, 'king_arthur' must vote YES for it to pass. If 'king_arthur' votes NO, it fails.

name: Board Approval
description: Only users with the role 'Board Member' are allowed to vote. The proposal passes if the majority of 'Board Member' votes are YES.

name: Jury Duty
description: A random jury of 3 users is selected to vote. The proposal passes only if at least 2 of the 3 jurors vote YES.

name: Token Weighted Voting
description: Votes are weighted by the number of tokens a user holds. If the sum of tokens from YES voters exceeds 60% of the total tokens of all voters, it passes.

name: Lazy Consensus (Time-based Pass)
description: If 48 hours have passed since the proposal started and there are NO votes against it (no vetoes), it passes automatically. If someone votes NO, it moves to a majority vote.

name: Majority with Timeout (Time-based Fail)
description: Requires a majority vote to pass. However, if the proposal is older than 3 days and still hasn't reached a majority, it should automatically FAIL.

name: Ranked Choice / Sequential
description: If no option has >50% first-choice votes, eliminate the lowest option and redistribute votes. (For this test, simply check if the 'winning_option' has >50% support).
